It is interesting to note a bit of Harry Potter's dialogue in the latest of the Potter series, The Half-Blood Prince:
 
 "Yeah, and others might say it's your duty to check that people really are Death Eaters before you chuck them in prison," said Harry, his temper rising now. "You're doing what Barry Crouch did. You never get it right, you people, do you? Either we've got Fudge, pretending everything's lovely while people get murdered right under his nose, or we've got you, chucking the wrong people into jail and trying to pretend you've got the 'Chosen One' working for you!"
It is laudable to get lessons in politics through a weekend binging on Harry Potter.

It is interesting to note a bit of Harry Potter's dialogue in the latest of the Potter series, The Half-Blood Prince:
 
 "Yeah, and others might say it's your duty to check that people really are Death Eaters before you chuck them in prison," said Harry, his temper rising now. "You're doing what Barry Crouch did. You never get it right, you people, do you? Either we've got Fudge, pretending everything's lovely while people get murdered right under his nose, or we've got you, chucking the wrong people into jail and trying to pretend you've got the 'Chosen One' working for you!"

 
 Since when are death eaters people?

They appear to be so in the fictional world of Harry Potter.
 
 By the way, I've always kind of wondered if Voldemort were not modelled after Dick Cheney.

So is the new book any good,as good as the others or what?
 
 No spoilers,i'm still awaiting my copy from Amason.
Just finished it. I think it's better than anything else she's done.

title: 4Forums.com Political Debates and Polls -  Azkaban and Abu Ghraib
